intro: Psychotria chagrensis, commonly known as Chagren's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
